papers_cited.title: Reconstructing Visual Experiences from Brain Activity Evoked by Natural Movies

body: génial ! Encore un peu, et on pourra enregistrer ses rêves :-) génial ! Encore un peu, et on pourra enregistrer ses rêves :-) Reconstruction from brain activity The left clip is a segment of a Hollywood movie trailed that the subject viewed while in the magnet. The right clip shows the reconstruction of this segment from brain activity measured using fMRI. The procedure is as follows: [1] Record brain activity while the subject watches several hours of movie trailers. [2] Build dictionaries (regression model) to translate between the shapes, edges and motion in the movies and measured brain activity. A separate dictionary is constructed for each of several thousand points in the brain at which brain activity was measured. (For experts: our success here in building a movie-to-brain activity encoding model was one of the keys of this study) [3] Record brain activity to a new set of movie trailers that will be used to test the quality of the dictionaries and reconstructions. [4] Build a random library of ~18,000,000 seconds of video downloaded at random from YouTube (that have no overlap with the movies subjects saw in the magnet). Put each of these clips through the dictionaries to generate predictions of brain activity. Select the 100 clips whose predicted activity is most similar to the observed brain activity. Average those clips together. This is the reconstruction. For a related video see: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KMA23JJ1M1o For the paper (Nishimoto et al., 2011, Current Biology) go to:http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.cub.2011.08.031 For more information about this work, please check our lab web site:http://gallantlab.org http://www.youtube.com/v/nsjDnYxJ0bo&hl=en&fs=1&autoplay=1

papers_cited.title: Is there a role for carbohydrate restriction in the treatment and prevention of cancer?

body:
This is a great open-access review of what we know regarding sugar and carbohydrate restriction i... This is a great open-access review of what we know regarding sugar and carbohydrate restriction in cancer. Not only are a tumor's metabolic requirements greater, making it favor higher blood glucose spikes, but it requires more sugar than other cells due to dysfunctional mitochondria and a resultant difficulty with fatty acid metabolism. Additionally, the higher levels of blood glucose stimulate higher insulin secretions, and insulin is wholly anabolic and pro-growth.

This is why we ask that refined sugar and other "high-glycemic" sources of carbohydrate be removed from the cancer patient's diet. Even the transient spike in blood glucose that results from their consumption can favor tumor progression, especially if consistently experienced. Nutrition & Metabolism | Abstract | Is there a role for carbohydrate restriction in the treatment and prevention of cancer? http://www.nutritionandmetabolism.com/content/8/1/75/abstract

body:
El trabajo científico del día 28 en " Materiales Dentales"-"Implantes"
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"Minimally invasive transcrestal sinus floor elevation with graft biomaterials. A randomized clinical trial "
Clinical Oral Implants Research, 10/27/2011 Trombelli L et al. – 

The Smart Lift technique in conjunction with the additional use of either synthetic hydroxyapatite in a collagen matrix (S–HA) or deproteinized bovine bone mineral (DBBM) may provide a predictable elevation of the maxillary sinus floor along with limited post–surgical complications and post–operative pain/discomfort. Sinus lift (SL) and aGH were significantly greater at 6 months for S–HA than DBBM.
